project.teaser: Major depressive disorder (MDD) is the leading cause of disability worldwide, affecting 300 million people with a lifetime prevalence of 15%. Approximately one third of all MDD patients fail to respond to currently established treatments based on medication and psychotherapy...
project.objective: Major depressive disorder (MDD) is the leading cause of disability worldwide, affecting 300 million people with a lifetime prevalence of 15%. Approximately one third of all MDD patients fail to respond to currently established treatments based on medication and psychotherapy, thus falling into the category of Treatment-Resistant Depression (TRD) patients. Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT), repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (tRMS), Vagus nerve stimulation, deep brain stimulation (DBS) and transcranial focused ultrasound (tFUS) still show poor spatial resolution (ECT, tRMS, tFUS) or low network coverage (VNS, DBS), with average remission rates in clinical trials still lower than 30 %. Apart from the existing stimulation hurdles, reliable biomarkers for depression are needed as a diagnostic tool, and, in the case of NT, to determine the stimulation efficacy and allow for personalized treatment. The UPSIDE project proposes a minimally invasive, high spatial resolution and multi-brain region stimulation and recording system to largely exceed the capabilities of existing NT for depression. Our objective is to research and validate in vivo an hybrid neurotechnology consisting of an epidural focused ultrasound (eFUS) stimulator employing three-dimensional beamforming, and a high-density epidural EEG recording system. Epidural deployment of these devices will be enabled by novel methods for massive integration and miniaturization of high-performing piezoelectric ultrasound materials and high-fidelity organic bioelectronic materials with high energy-efficient complementary metal-oxide semiconductor (CMOS) technology in a biocompatible manner. The UPSIDE project will result in a demonstrator which will allow, for the first time, network stimulation and simultaneous biomarker readout in behavioral experiments with animal models featuring depression-like symptoms. This technological breakthrough will pave the way towards a personalized treatment for TRD.
project.title: Focused Ultrasound Personalized Therapy for the Treatment of Depression (UPSIDE)
project.keywords: Ultrasound neuromodulation, neuronal recording, closed-loop stimulation, treatment resistant depression

article.title: Novel stimulation and recording system for treatment-resistant depression patients

result.title: Chronic in vivo sequelae of repetitive acute mfb‐<scp>DBS</scp> on accumbal dopamine and midbrain neuronal activity

details.authors: Lidia Miguel Telega, Danesh Ashouri Vajari, Chockalingam Ramanathan, Volker A. Coenen, Máté D. Döbrössy

result.title: CMOS recording interface with ~64 channels for EEG recording and passive MEAs
result.description: This report will include electrical characterization results of a CMOS interface demonstrator, including graphs showing power consumption, noise performance, and transfer function of the recording channels. The report will include characterizations with and without the passive MEA, as well as a description of the MEA/CMOS interconnect.

result.title: Hybrid neuroelectronics: towards a solution-centric way of thinking about complexproblems in neurostimulation tools

details.authors: Sofia Drakopoulou; Francesc Varkevisser; Linta Sohail; Masoumeh Aqamolaei; Tiago L. Costa; George D. Spyropoulos

result.title: 2D Phased Array Driving Scheme Optimization for Ultrasound Neuromodulation

details.journalTitle: 2024 IEEE Ultrasonics, Ferroelectrics, and Frequency Control Joint Symposium (UFFC-JS)

result.title: An Acoustically Transparent Electrical Cap for Piezoelectric Ultrasound Transducers on Silicon

details.authors: Gandhika K. Wardhana, Tiago L. Costa, Massimo Mastrangeli

result.title: Internal and public website (regularly updated)
result.description: Internal project coordination tool public internet website and other social media channels to communicate and disseminate the project results

result.title: In vivo LFP detection with conformable passive MEA (>1500 electrodes/cm2)
result.description: This report will present photos and characterization graphs (e.g. electrochemical impedance) of the passive microelectrode arrays, as well as time-frequency spectrograms of LFP recordings from a cortical surface with designated behavioural states, high-pass filtered traces of waveforms, trigger averaging of waveforms demonstrating consistent action potential morphology, and autocorrelograms indicative of neural firing refractory periods.

result.title: Data management plan - V1
result.description: This plan will describe what data the project will identify and generate how to handle with it and how the FAIR principles will be implemented

result.title: eFUS chip: Biological/histological evidence of efficacy
result.description: The report will include the first in vivo results using the eFUS chip manufactured by the consortium. The eFUS chip will be implanted and the animals will recover, and will be stimulated over 5 days according to pre-determined parameters. Histological methods will describe the biological effects of the eFUS (e.g. c-fos, TUNNEL, inflammation markers, etc). Molecular methods will describe regional changes in gene expression in key areas (mPFC, NAc).

result.title: Prototype of relay station
result.description: This report will present electrical characterization results of the manufactured demonstrator of the relay station. This will include time-domain graphs with the input and output signals of a microcontroller used to program and acquired data from the eREC and eFUS devices, graphs with the characterization of the power unit in the relay station and demonstration of wireless connectivity with a computer by sending and receiving programming commands.

result.title: LIFU for major depressive disorder – Targeting the neural networks of depression
Acute and chronic gene expression activation following medial forebrain bundle DBS and selective dopamine pathway stimulation

details.authors: Zhuo Duan, Wen Zhao, Yixin Tong, Volker A. Coenen, Máté D. Döbrössy
details.publisher: Springer Science and Business Media LLC

result.title: Project Handbook
result.description: This deliverable will consist of a guide to implementation the UPSIDE project It includes a detailed project management plan including the Gantt chart and the Work Package structure the schedule per task responsible partner for the related subtasks the related deliverables and the dependencies on other tasks The handbook should act as a a reference source for all consortium members covering many daytoday activities

result.title: A Power-Efficient Oscillatory Synchronization Feature Extractor for Closed-Loop Neuromodulation

details.authors: Hoda Yassin, Arash Akhoundi, El-Sayed Hasaneen, Dante G. Muratore
details.journalTitle: IEEE Transactions on Circuits and Systems II: Express Briefs
details.publisher: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE)

result.title: Conformable IGT-array (>1500 interfaces/cm2) with superior SNR (>20 dB increase) and >1 month in vitro stability
result.description: This report will present photos and characterization graphs (e.g. IVgraphs, temporal response, frequency response) of the IGT array. In addition, we will show comparable acquired electrophysiological signals from IGT and passive arrays with SNR increase. In-vitro stability will be shown with prolonged operation (drain current modulation for pulsed gate voltage) in physiologic conditions.

result.title: R2 updates on the DMP
result.description: First update of the Data Management Plan (DMP)

result.title: Reserpine-induced rat model for depression: Behavioral, physiological and PET-based dopamine receptor availability validation

details.authors: Lidia Miguel Telega, Raissa Berti, Ganna Blazhenets, Lisa-Charlotte Domogalla, Nils Steinacker, M. Aymen Omrane, Philipp T. Meyer, Volker A. Coenen, Ann-Christin Eder, Máté D. Döbrössy
details.journalTitle: Progress in Neuro-Psychopharmacology and Biological Psychiatry

result.title: Soft electronics and materials for ear to brain engineering

details.journalTitle: Proceedings of the MATSUS Fall 2023 Conference
details.publisher: FUNDACIO DE LA COMUNITAT VALENCIANA SCITO

result.title: Neuronal networks of depression: Pushing the limits of brain stimulation technology

details.authors: Tiago Costa, Volker Arnd Coenen, Máté Dániel Döbrössy

result.title: Report on the integration of CMOS 64-channel recording interface with passive MEA (eREC64)
result.description: This report will include results of electrical characterization of the CMOS 64-channel recording interface with assembled and interconnected passive MEAs, including: (i) time-domain graphs with the recorded data resulting from stimulation a saline solution with a passive tungsten electrode. (ii) noise plots obtained with a spectrum analyzer will also be reported here, with annotations representing the fully integrated noise in the bandwidth of interest. (iii) transfer-function frequency plot obtained from a network analyzer.

result.title: A Low-Power Oscillatory Feature Extraction Unit for Implantable Neural Interfaces

details.journalTitle: IEEE International Symposium on Circuits and Systems (ISCAS)

result.title: in vivo targeting of FUS stimulation: safety and precision
result.description: The report will include the results of in vivo acute studies using commercially available FUS in anaesthetized rats. The data described will concern the safety aspects, and the refinement of the “targeting”. Biological effects of the stimulation will be confirmed during the surgical session using electrophysiological methods, and post-mortem by using histological methods. Regions of interest examined will include mPFC, and NAc, for example.

result.title: Major depressive disorder: Brain signals as biomarkers for depression
Periodic Reporting for period 2 - UPSIDE (Focused Ultrasound Personalized Therapy for the Treatment of Depression (UPSIDE))
result.teaser: The UPSIDE project proposes an Epidural Brain Interface (EBI) featuring a minimally invasive, responsive neural stimulation system that utilizes focused ultrasound multi-brain region stimulation (eFUS) and high spatio-temporal resolution electrical recording (eREC) to innovate...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Low-Intensity Focused Ultrasound (LIFU) is an emerging neuromodulation method for treating major depressive disorder which allows for non-invasive stimulation across the whole brain
PMUT and CMUT Devices for Biomedical Applications: A Review

details.authors: Elisabetta Moisello, Lara Novaresi, Eshani Sarkar, Piero Malcovati, Tiago L. Costa, Edoardo Bonizzoni
details.publisher: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE)

result.title: Plan for dissemination, communication and exploitation
result.description: This plan describes the strategy procedures and tool for dissemination communication and exploitation of project results and also focuses on the public engagement

result.title: Report on chronic detection of EEG signals for biomarker detection algorithms, in an in vivo animal model with IGT-array for >3 weeks
result.description: This report will show photos of IGT-based devices, placement procedure, and EEG data acquired by an IGT array over > 3 weeks period of time. Time-frequency spectrograms of the recordings, high filtered traces of waveforms will be shown indicating potential biomarkers. Spectrograms and raw data will be analysed to understand best methods to extract depression biomarkers.

result.title: eFUS chip implantation protocol and preliminary FUS stimulation parameters
result.description: The report will include the results of our initial in vivo and ex vivo studies using phantom agar and post-mortem fixed and unfixed brains. These preliminary studies will use commercially available FUS. The report will include protocols and parameters concerning the intensity and targeting of the stimulation which will be transferred over to the device emerging from the other WPs. The report will also describe craniotomy and protocols to implant “dummy” eFUS and eREC chips.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
